proposals.reasoning: I want at least one slot to be known good to me, so I’m putting myself on the mission. Between the common suggestions (Charlie + Diana vs. Alice + Charlie), most of the table has leaned toward Alice + me, and I previously said I slightly prefer that as well. This lineup gives us a solid chance at a clean first success while also maximizing informational value, since both team members have already put opinions on record and everyone else’s votes and reactions to this team will be easier to interpret. We should still avoid hard-clearing either of us off a single success.

votes.comment: I’m on it, the table has mostly leaned toward this pairing, and it should give us both good odds of a clean start and useful voting information.
Consistent with my earlier stance—this team gives a good chance at a clean start while keeping both members from being over-cleared off one result.
I know I’m good, don’t have a strong reason to distrust Alice yet, and this gives us early mission and voting info without wasting a proposal.
Table’s clearly gravitated to Alice+Charlie and I said I wouldn’t fight it; fine as an opener as long as we don’t soft-clear either off a single success.
I already said I slightly preferred Alice + Charlie for Quest 1; this gives good info with no strong reason to distrust either yet.

discussion.content: For a small first team I’d actually rather see two people who aren’t usually in the spotlight—something like Charlie + Diana—so we get a baseline, but we should be careful not to hard-clear anyone off just one success.

I’m fine with Charlie + Diana as an opener, as long as we’re all clear that a success there doesn’t auto-clear either of them. If we want more to read from people’s stances though, I’d slightly prefer Alice + Charlie so at least one person on the team has already put some opinions on record.

I definitely want to be on the first team so at least one slot is known good to me; between the two, I slightly prefer Alice + me so we get both a decent shot at success and clearer reactions from the table.

I slightly prefer Charlie + me for the first mission so we keep it simple and get to read the louder voices from the outside through their votes and reactions. That said, if everyone really gravitates to Alice + Charlie, I’m not going to die on this hill.

Between those options I slightly prefer Alice + Charlie as well—if something weird happens, it’s easier to line it up with the reads they’ve already put out. Just don’t soft-clear either of them off a single success.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 with Alice and Charlie was clean, but a 2-player success doesn’t prove both are good since an evil can easily pass early. I’d like to avoid auto-locking the Alice–Charlie pair this soon, while still keeping some continuity, so I’m keeping Charlie (as the leader who picked a successful first team) and rotating Alice off for one round. I’m putting myself on because I know I’m good and I’m happy to be scrutinized, and I want to bring Eve in now so she’s tested early rather than leaving her completely unknown until later. Bob also explicitly said he’s fine sitting this one out, which makes it easier to leave him off for now. This team spreads information without overcommitting to the initial pair and, if it passes, gives us a solid three-person group to lean on going forward.

votes.comment: I still want to keep the proven Alice–Charlie core and just add one new player; dropping Alice entirely for a new trio feels premature.
I’d rather keep Alice from the clean first mission and not swap in two new people at once; this team moves too far from our only data point.

Alice is our most cleared player from Mission 1, so I’d rather keep her on and add only one new person; putting both Diana and Eve on together needlessly raises the risk and breaks up the strongest-looking pair.
This keeps continuity with the clean first mission via Charlie, avoids auto-locking the Alice–Charlie pair too early, and gives us early info on both me and Eve while Bob is happy to sit.
I’d rather keep the Alice–Charlie core and add me (ACE); swapping Alice out for Diana here feels like an unnecessary and riskier pivot from the cleaner Mission 1 pair.

proposals.reasoning: I’m keeping the Alice–Charlie core that just succeeded and adding myself as the single new variable, as I argued during discussion. This avoids committing early to either Bob or Diana or locking in a Charlie–Diana pairing, and it gives us clean information: if this team fails, we know at least one of Alice/Charlie is bad; if it passes, that pair becomes much more trustworthy.

votes.comment: It keeps the proven Alice–Charlie core and adds only Eve as a single new variable, which should give us clear info.
Keeps the Alice–Charlie core that already succeeded and adds Eve as a single new variable for information.
Keeping the Alice–me core with one new variable is a solid low-risk Mission 2; I’d have slightly preferred testing Diana or Bob, but this is still acceptable.
I don’t love rerunning the full Alice–Charlie core again this early; I’d rather mix it up and only keep one of them so we get clearer information from mission 2.
Keeping the successful Alice–Charlie core and adding myself while leaving out the especially suspicious Diana looks like our highest-probability all-good team right now.

discussion.content: Since Mission 1 with me and Charlie was clean, I’d like to keep that core and add one new person. Bob feels like a reasonable third to me right now, but I’m also fine swapping him for Diana if people are uneasy.

Keeping the Alice–Charlie pair for now makes sense to me, and I’m happy to be the third, but if people are uneasy I’m also fine sitting out and letting Diana take the spot so we get a read on that lineup.
I like keeping the Alice–me core for now, but I’d lean toward adding Diana this round so we get information on a new pairing rather than locking Bob in early off just one clean mission.

Given the clean first mission, I’m fine keeping Alice and Charlie together, and between Bob and me as the third I’d lean toward me this time since Bob’s already said he’s happy to sit. We can then make sure Eve and Bob both get on later missions so we’re not tunnelling too hard on one lineup.

I’d actually like to see Alice–Charlie–me this round so we’re not overcommitting to either Bob or Diana yet. If you really want to stick with the original core plus a third, I’d lean Bob over Diana just to avoid Charlie and Diana being locked together this early.

proposals.reasoning: I want exactly one of {Alice, Charlie, Eve} from the failed Mission 2 while benching Eve, which matches the logic most of the table has been using. Charlie comes from the clean two-person Mission 1, and pairing him with a new player gives us fresh information. Among those anchor+new options, Bob + Charlie has the broadest stated support (both Bob and Charlie preferred it) and fits my earlier suggestion of choosing one of {me/Charlie} plus one of {Bob/Diana} without repeating the full Mission 2 lineup.

votes.comment: This matches my earlier logic: exactly one from the Mission 2 suspect trio plus a new player, benching Eve and reusing Charlie from the clean Mission 1.
Matches what I pushed for earlier: keep Eve off, keep Charlie from the clean Mission 1, and add me as new info.
Matches my stated preference: keeps me from the clean Mission 1, benches Eve after the fail, and tests a new player (Bob) for information.
I still prefer Charlie + me over Charlie + Bob here—Bob’s completely untested and I’d rather not send a two‑person team I’m not on.
Charlie is still a prime suspect from the failed Mission 2, so I don’t want him anchoring a 2‑person team with an untested partner like Bob.

discussion.content: Given that mission 1 with just me and Charlie passed clean, I still trust that pair more than Eve right now. I’d like this team to be one of {me/Charlie} plus one of {Bob/Diana} so we’re testing someone new without repeating the exact failing set.

I’m on board with keeping Eve off this one for now; out of those pairs I slightly prefer Charlie + me, since that keeps the Mission 1 “safer” core involved while finally giving the table some data on a new player.

From my point of view the fail on Mission 2 has to come from either Alice or Eve, so I really want Eve off this team and would prefer a two-person of me plus either Bob or Diana—slight lean to Charlie + Bob since that keeps a “core” I’m comfortable with and adds new info.

Given the fail has to be somewhere in {Alice, Charlie, Eve}, I’d like a 2-person team that keeps exactly one of that trio plus a new player. Using Charlie as the anchor and pairing him with me (Charlie + Diana) feels a bit safer than Charlie + Bob to me right now.

Given the fail definitely came from {Alice, Charlie, me}, the 2‑person team I trust most is me + Bob or me + Diana. If you won’t put me on, I’d rather see Bob + Diana than keep leaning on the Alice/Charlie core from the failed mission.

proposals.reasoning: Charlie is the only player who’s been on both failed missions, and Diana has been pushing hard to keep him on teams, which makes that pairing risky. A team of Alice, me, and Eve keeps both Charlie and Diana off the board while giving us a new configuration to test among the remaining three, aligning with Eve’s stated preference and avoiding the overlap that’s caused the last two fails.

votes.comment: Keeps both Charlie and Diana, who I’m most suspicious of, off the team and gives us a fresh combo to test among the rest.
This keeps Charlie—the overlap on both failed missions—and Diana, who keeps backing him, off the team and tests the remaining trio.
Given the mission results and knowing I’m good, every consistent evil pair includes Bob, so I won’t approve any team with him on it.
Team has both Alice and Bob, who have each been on a failed mission; I don't want them together on this critical quest.
Charlie is on both failed missions and Diana keeps defending him; this team leaves them both out and is our best bet for an all-good lineup.

discussion.content: Mission 2’s fail was [me, Charlie, Eve] and mission 3’s was [Bob, Charlie], so with only two evils the cleanest explanation is that Charlie is the overlap causing both. I’d much rather see a team like Bob, Diana, and either me or Eve that finally leaves Charlie off and gives us a cleaner read.

Given that both Charlie and I were on the last fail and he’s the overlap on *both* bad missions, we both look pretty dodgy right now. I’m happy to sit this one out and would rather see a fresh team of Alice, Diana, and Eve go.

Diana’s the only one who hasn’t been on a failed mission, and the way Alice built Mission 3 makes me more wary of her than Eve, so I’d like to see a team of me, Diana, and Eve. Whatever we do, I really think we should keep Bob off this one.

I’m not convinced we should auto-blame Charlie just because he overlaps the fails, especially when Alice and Bob have each been on a failed mission too. Right now I’m most comfortable with a Charlie / Eve / me team.

Given Charlie’s on both failed teams and Diana’s really determined to keep him in, I’m a lot happier with a team of Alice, Bob, and me. That keeps the two biggest question marks off while giving us a fresh combo to test.
